title: K-12 AI Literacy Instructional Design Expert Training Program for Elementary Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational theory, understanding of constructivist approaches, and elementary education environment experience
context.additional_context: Strengthening competency in designing AI literacy education linked to mathematics curriculum, implementing collaborative learning in BYOD environments

learning_goals: They can design an AI literacy education framework suitable for the elementary education level (conceptual understanding, ethical problem-solving, data analysis).

Learners can design three AI education scenarios (e.g., chatbot development, image classification model design, recommendation system implementation) using constructivist and project-based learning strategies, achieving a total suitability score of over 80% through peer evaluation (approval by at least two out of three peers) and expert review (4+ on a 5-point scale).

Learners can generate formative assessment questions with over 80% accuracy using AI tools (intelligent agents) in mathematical problem-solving processes and establish a system to provide feedback to at least three peer learners within four months.

resources: AI Education Platform (e.g., Machine Learning for Kids)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
